title: Why does every new champion have a ton of moblilty
body: Remember when a champion would have either a speed up spell or a blink/dash ? Now , it's almost a crime if the champion does not have both , and probably have cc in their kit as well. Camille has a speed up , a stun , a dash , a slow and a fucking bermuda triangle. Kled has his ulti , his joust and his trap bear on a rope. Ekko has a speed up , a slow , a stun , 2 dashes and his ulti. Hell , even the new Galio seems to have decent mobility. I am not judging if these champions are overpowered or not , but I am saying that mobility is now something generic. And hey , if all else fails , just build a protobelt :)

Almost every season 6 champion (barring Camille who was a nightmare) either had extremely low mobility or extremely conditional mobility. (Taliyah's is on her ult. Jhin has to crit. Aurelion Sol is out of combat, Illaoi's is a tiny leap).

Meanwhile in earlier seasons...

{{champion:67}} MS boost as a passive and a tumble...on top of CC/knockback.
{{champion:236}} THE DASHLORD
{{champion:429}} plz no
{{champion:7}} [SCREECH]
{{champion:92}} Free dashes forever
{{champion:64}} I hate you.

If anything, Riot has been greatly lowering the amount of free dashing/mobility in kits. And no. Riven tapping Q three times to ignore slows is not the same caliber of movement as Ivern tagging a unit and being able to move to them every 14-6 seconds if he hits it.

{{champion:420}} Q is a small Dash, interruptable.
{{champion:202}} Passive gives massive MS for chasing
{{champion:163}} Ult is a near map-wide dash
{{champion:136}} E
{{champion:427}} Q gives a Dash to not only him, but any ally, and or Daisy.

Repeat:

>Almost every season 6 champion (barring Camille who was a nightmare) **either had extremely low mobility or extremely conditional mobility.**

Kled's dash is short and can't go over walls. (Unless you count his unmounted Q but that means he loses his other dash.)

Also, yes, they are conditional. Ivern has to hit his (fairly slow) Q and go in on a pre-determined track along with everyone else. Jhin has to itemize crit or get to his fourth shot for that speed boost. Taliyah/Aurelion Sol has to be out of combat to move quickly across the map, etc. The requirements might be simple, yes, but those requirements are often easily telegraphed and built up slowly.

Compare this to {{champion:7}} who can almost instantly dash in and teleport out by double tapping Q. Or {{champion:64}} who can drop a ward/wardhop in an amazingly fast span. {{champion:67}} tapping Q and slightly repositioning every few seconds. etc.

Even if you don't think they're all that conditional, they're pretty damn conditional when you compare them to other champions in the game.

This has nothing to do with how good or bad a champion is. This has everything to do with how easy/conditional their mobility is.

It's more fun to play that way and gives more of a chance for an outplay.

And makes all Mages that have by nature telegraphed, delayed and aimed skills irrelevant. Very fun to play against something that dashes around you dodging everything, then jumps on you while you are having CDs and deletes you with few clicks and undelayed burst. Then to counter that there is bullshit like Syndra's and Malzahar's ult (and Malzahar's kit as whole) and even Syndra's ult is a little telegraphed and both indirectly and directly delayed.

One of the reason champs like Talyah and Aurelion aren't played much in low elo is because there is way too much champions doing damage faster than them, more reliably that also have mobility to avoid theirs.

If it will continue like this then there will be more Mages that just need to get lucky to hit one ability and delete half your HP and people will then cry about it, because instead of not overloading mobility, cancer will be fought by cancer.
